channel.title: Open Source Stories
channel.itunes:subtitle: Exploring open source narratives
channel.itunes:author: StoryCorps
channel.itunes:summary:
Open source is more than what we find in a repository.
Open source is collaboration, communication, community, and more.
The Open Source Stories project celebrates this expanded view on what is counted and who represents open source by collecting narratives from creators, contributors, and consumers alike.
Our goal is to make the people of open source and their lived experiences more visible.
channel.description:
Open source is more than what we find in a repository.
Open source is collaboration, communication, community, and more.
The Open Source Stories project celebrates this expanded view on what is counted and who represents open source by collecting narratives from creators, contributors, and consumers alike.
Our goal is to make the people of open source and their lived experiences more visible.

item.itunes:title: How we show up in open source with Julia Silge
item.title: How we show up in open source with Julia Silge
item.itunes:subtitle: Ever wonder if you're the only one who feels like open source is a mystery? Julia Silge shares how she went from thinking it was just "some person alone in a room" to realizing it's a whole world of collaboration and community! Plus, find out why being wrong on the internet isn't so bad after all.
item.itunes:summary: Ever wonder if you're the only one who feels like open source is a mystery? Julia Silge shares how she went from thinking it was just "some person alone in a room" to realizing it's a whole world of collaboration and community! Plus, find out why being wrong on the internet isn't so bad after all.
item.description: Ever wonder if you're the only one who feels like open source is a mystery? Julia Silge shares how she went from thinking it was just "some person alone in a room" to realizing it's a whole world of collaboration and community! Plus, find out why being wrong on the internet isn't so bad after all.

item.itunes:title: The Open Source Eras Tour with Erin McKean
item.title: The Open Source Eras Tour with Erin McKean
item.itunes:subtitle: Dive into a whimsical view of open source with Erin McKean as she examines it through the lens of Taylor Swift's Eras. From the "Inventor Era" to the "Responsibility Era," Erin explores how the focus of open source has changed over time. Discover why you need napkins and what "fully automated luxury space communism" might have to do with it all!
item.itunes:summary: Dive into a whimsical view of open source with Erin McKean as she examines it through the lens of Taylor Swift's Eras. From the "Inventor Era" to the "Responsibility Era," Erin explores how the focus of open source has changed over time. Discover why you need napkins and what "fully automated luxury space communism" might have to do with it all!
item.description: Dive into a whimsical view of open source with Erin McKean as she examines it through the lens of Taylor Swift's Eras. From the "Inventor Era" to the "Responsibility Era," Erin explores how the focus of open source has changed over time. Discover why you need napkins and what "fully automated luxury space communism" might have to do with it all!

item.itunes:title: Focus and feedback in the tidyverse
item.title: Focus and feedback in the tidyverse
item.itunes:subtitle: Hadley Wickham takes Tracy Teal through the evolution of the tidyverse, starting with a box of rocks all the way through to a thriving community of data scientists. Join them on the Open Source Story of the tidyverse!
item.itunes:summary: Hadley Wickham takes Tracy Teal through the evolution of the tidyverse, starting with a box of rocks all the way through to a thriving community of data scientists. Join them on the Open Source Story of the tidyverse!
item.description: Hadley Wickham takes Tracy Teal through the evolution of the tidyverse, starting with a box of rocks all the way through to a thriving community of data scientists. Join them on the Open Source Story of the tidyverse!

item.itunes:title: Changing communities have changing needs with Andy Piper
item.title: Changing communities have changing needs with Andy Piper
item.itunes:subtitle: In this conversation between Andy Piper and amanda casari, Andy talks about their work in open source communities, specifically highlighting how communities differ, have different needs, and how these needs change and evolve over time. Additionally the discussion covers the “non-glamourous” work that needs to be done, and how difficult it can be to know what sort of help to ask for as a project.
item.itunes:summary: In this conversation between Andy Piper and amanda casari, Andy talks about their work in open source communities, specifically highlighting how communities differ, have different needs, and how these needs change and evolve over time. Additionally the discussion covers the “non-glamourous” work that needs to be done, and how difficult it can be to know what sort of help to ask for as a project.
item.description: In this conversation between Andy Piper and amanda casari, Andy talks about their work in open source communities, specifically highlighting how communities differ, have different needs, and how these needs change and evolve over time. Additionally the discussion covers the “non-glamourous” work that needs to be done, and how difficult it can be to know what sort of help to ask for as a project.

item.itunes:title: "Why do we code?" and other musings with Carol Willing
item.title: "Why do we code?" and other musings with Carol Willing
item.itunes:subtitle: Carol Willing, a veteran programmer with a passion for making technology accessible, shares her journey from mainframe computers to the world of Python and Jupyter Notebooks. She emphasizes the importance of generalist skills, critical thinking, and building up the next generation of engineers.
item.itunes:summary: Carol Willing, a veteran programmer with a passion for making technology accessible, shares her journey from mainframe computers to the world of Python and Jupyter Notebooks. She emphasizes the importance of generalist skills, critical thinking, and building up the next generation of engineers.

She emphasizes the importance of generalist skills, critical thinking, and building up the next generation of engineers.

item.itunes:title: Rethinking the meaning of governance with Shauna Gordon-McKeon
item.title: Rethinking the meaning of governance with Shauna Gordon-McKeon
item.itunes:subtitle: In a conversation looking at multiple meanings of open source governance and project health, Shauna Gordon-McKeon shares with Open Source Stories views of how investing in project culture can build virtuous cycles of inclusion and contribution. From reducing the number of roles that a maintainer might have to fill to lowering the barriers for user participation - this conversation looks to build from crisis management in 2017 to continuing improvements into the future with the ways open source projects get done.
item.itunes:summary: In a conversation looking at multiple meanings of open source governance and project health, Shauna Gordon-McKeon shares with Open Source Stories views of how investing in project culture can build virtuous cycles of inclusion and contribution. From reducing the number of roles that a maintainer might have to fill to lowering the barriers for user participation - this conversation looks to build from crisis management in 2017 to continuing improvements into the future with the ways open source projects get done.
item.description: In a conversation looking at multiple meanings of open source governance and project health, Shauna Gordon-McKeon shares with Open Source Stories views of how investing in project culture can build virtuous cycles of inclusion and contribution. From reducing the number of roles that a maintainer might have to fill to lowering the barriers for user participation - this conversation looks to build from crisis management in 2017 to continuing improvements into the future with the ways open source projects get done.

item.itunes:title: The power and joy in collaboration with Clare Dillon
item.title: The power and joy in collaboration with Clare Dillon
item.itunes:subtitle: Why should open source have all the fun? Clare Dillon shares her experience in the wonderful world of innersource, the application of open source practices within organizations. Collaboration is just too exciting not to share!
item.itunes:summary: Why should open source have all the fun? Clare Dillon shares her experience in the wonderful world of innersource, the application of open source practices within organizations. Collaboration is just too exciting not to share!
item.description: Why should open source have all the fun? Clare Dillon shares her experience in the wonderful world of innersource, the application of open source practices within organizations. Collaboration is just too exciting not to share!

item.itunes:title: Community health and belonging with Anita Ihuman
item.title: Community health and belonging with Anita Ihuman
item.itunes:subtitle: Measuring community health reveals challenges people experience in contributing. Anita Ihuman explains how to build awareness and leverage existing solutions for greater belonging in open source. What you measure, you can see and change!
item.itunes:summary: Measuring community health reveals challenges people experience in contributing. Anita Ihuman explains how to build awareness and leverage existing solutions for greater belonging in open source. What you measure, you can see and change!
item.description: Measuring community health reveals challenges people experience in contributing. Anita Ihuman explains how to build awareness and leverage existing solutions for greater belonging in open source. What you measure, you can see and change!

item.itunes:title: The peculiarities of security maintainership with Filippo Valsorda
item.title: The peculiarities of security maintainership with Filippo Valsorda
item.itunes:subtitle: What changes when the projects you maintain are cornerstones of security? Filippo Valsorda elaborates on his experience as a cryptographer, his work in Go, and how his approach to maintainership might be a bit different from the average maintainer.
item.itunes:summary: What changes when the projects you maintain are cornerstones of security? Filippo Valsorda elaborates on his experience as a cryptographer, his work in Go, and how his approach to maintainership might be a bit different from the average maintainer.
item.description: What changes when the projects you maintain are cornerstones of security? Filippo Valsorda elaborates on his experience as a cryptographer, his work in Go, and how his approach to maintainership might be a bit different from the average maintainer.

item.itunes:title: The journey to becoming a maintainer with Jessica Tegner
item.title: The journey to becoming a maintainer with Jessica Tegner
item.itunes:subtitle: How does one pick up the maintainership baton? Turns out that you can ask for it! Jessica Tegner tells the story of how she went from contributing to pypandoc to being the maintainer of it, and the pressures that come from maintaining a widely used project.
item.itunes:summary: How does one pick up the maintainership baton? Turns out that you can ask for it! Jessica Tegner tells the story of how she went from contributing to pypandoc to being the maintainer of it, and the pressures that come from maintaining a widely used project.
item.description: How does one pick up the maintainership baton? Turns out that you can ask for it! Jessica Tegner tells the story of how she went from contributing to pypandoc to being the maintainer of it, and the pressures that come from maintaining a widely used project.

item.itunes:title: The critical human infrastructure of open source with Duane O'Brien
item.title: The critical human infrastructure of open source with Duane O'Brien
item.itunes:subtitle: Open source is people and people are open source. Duane O'Brien talks about what he's learned about supporting, connecting with, and caring for the critical human infrastructure of open source.
item.itunes:summary: Open source is people and people are open source. Duane O'Brien talks about what he's learned about supporting, connecting with, and caring for the critical human infrastructure of open source.
item.description: Open source is people and people are open source. Duane O'Brien talks about what he's learned about supporting, connecting with, and caring for the critical human infrastructure of open source.

item.itunes:title: Open Hardware and Finding Your People with Thea Flowers
item.title: Open Hardware and Finding Your People with Thea Flowers
item.itunes:subtitle: If you find yourself curious about what’s running your software, then you’re in good company! Many Makers before you have cultivated our current open hardware opportunities to make it easier to start. Python Software Foundation Fellow Thea Flowers invites us to think beyond open source software to the vibrant community of open hardware. Bodge your way to greatness! In this episode, explore the right to repair, mid-scale manufacturing, and vinyl for video game soundtracks. Join Open Source Stories in finding your people.
item.itunes:summary: If you find yourself curious about what’s running your software, then you’re in good company! item.itunes:title: VM Brasseur on free and open source ecosystems and culture
item.title: VM Brasseur on free and open source ecosystems and culture
item.itunes:subtitle: Free and open source software is, or can be, a public good. But, VM Brasseur finds that for some, it may have gotten disconnected from its open culture roots. In this open source story, VM talks about motivations behind FOSS, how they have shifted, and how those who work in free and open source software can help recenter principles of openness.
item.itunes:summary: Free and open source software is, or can be, a public good. But, VM Brasseur finds that for some, it may have gotten disconnected from its open culture roots. In this open source story, VM talks about motivations behind FOSS, how they have shifted, and how those who work in free and open source software can help recenter principles of openness.
item.description: Free and open source software is, or can be, a public good. But, VM Brasseur finds that for some, it may have gotten disconnected from its open culture roots. In this open source story, VM talks about motivations behind FOSS, how they have shifted, and how those who work in free and open source software can help recenter principles of openness.

item.itunes:title: Alex Cabal and the Standard Ebooks “saga”
item.title: Alex Cabal and the Standard Ebooks “saga”
item.itunes:subtitle: Open source, the public domain, and various freedoms take center stage in the story behind Standard Ebooks. Learn about Standard Ebooks, a project founded by Alex Cabal to solve one particular problem, and how it brought together contributors with diverse sets of talents to make public domain literature works of art.
item.itunes:summary: Open source, the public domain, and various freedoms take center stage in the story behind Standard Ebooks. Learn about Standard Ebooks, a project founded by Alex Cabal to solve one particular problem, and how it brought together contributors with diverse sets of talents to make public domain literature works of art.

item.itunes:title: John Minnihan and the genesis of hosted source control
item.title: John Minnihan and the genesis of hosted source control
item.itunes:subtitle: John Minnihan walks through the creation of Freepository, the first hosted source control service, how it paved the way for lowering the barrier to participation in open source, and evolution of version control systems.
item.itunes:summary: John Minnihan walks through the creation of Freepository, the first hosted source control service, how it paved the way for lowering the barrier to participation in open source, and evolution of version control systems.
item.description: John Minnihan walks through the creation of Freepository, the first hosted source control service, how it paved the way for lowering the barrier to participation in open source, and evolution of version control systems.

item.itunes:title: Richard Littauer on birds, hats, and commitments
item.title: Richard Littauer on birds, hats, and commitments
item.itunes:subtitle: When you focus more on connections than commit-ments in open source, what do you say yes to? Richard talks about open source as an evolving collective and commons unbounded by strict definitions, working in the open with creativity and joy, and the practices which allow him to sustain himself as a collaborator.
item.itunes:summary: When you focus more on connections than commit-ments in open source, what do you say yes to? Richard talks about open source as an evolving collective and commons unbounded by strict definitions, working in the open with creativity and joy, and the practices which allow him to sustain himself as a collaborator.
item.description: When you focus more on connections than commit-ments in open source, what do you say yes to? Richard talks about open source as an evolving collective and commons unbounded by strict definitions, working in the open with creativity and joy, and the practices which allow him to sustain himself as a collaborator.

item.itunes:title: Eriol Fox on open source design
item.title: Eriol Fox on open source design
item.itunes:subtitle: What is open source design? Eriol dives into how designers contribute to open source, resources for designers looking to contribute to open source, and how incorporating design work into open source projects benefits the contributors and community using it.
item.itunes:summary: What is open source design? Eriol dives into how designers contribute to open source, resources for designers looking to contribute to open source, and how incorporating design work into open source projects benefits the contributors and community using it.
item.description: What is open source design? Eriol dives into how designers contribute to open source, resources for designers looking to contribute to open source, and how incorporating design work into open source projects benefits the contributors and community using it.

item.itunes:title: Dawn Wages on being an ethical open source engineer
item.title: Dawn Wages on being an ethical open source engineer
item.itunes:subtitle: How do we incorporate ethics into open source and software development at large? Dawn Wages describes some of the ways that she embraces ethical open source engineering, including exploring her guiding principles around how she makes technology decisions. Learn about how she works to bring anti-racist practices to the open source ecosystem.
item.itunes:summary: How do we incorporate ethics into open source and software development at large? Dawn Wages describes some of the ways that she embraces ethical open source engineering, including exploring her guiding principles around how she makes technology decisions. Learn about how she works to bring anti-racist practices to the open source ecosystem.

Learn about how she works to bring anti-racist practices to the open source ecosystem.

item.itunes:title: Open source maintainership with Emma Irwin
item.title: Open source maintainership with Emma Irwin
item.itunes:subtitle: Emma Irwin explores a nuanced view of open source maintainership in today’s landscape, digging into what characteristics good maintainers cultivate, what role mentoring plays in maintainership, and how history influences who becomes a maintainer.
item.itunes:summary: Emma Irwin explores a nuanced view of open source maintainership in today’s landscape, digging into what characteristics good maintainers cultivate, what role mentoring plays in maintainership, and how history influences who becomes a maintainer.
item.description: Emma Irwin explores a nuanced view of open source maintainership in today’s landscape, digging into what characteristics good maintainers cultivate, what role mentoring plays in maintainership, and how history influences who becomes a maintainer.

item.itunes:title: Nicolas Steenhout explores the intersection of accessibility and open source
item.title: Nicolas Steenhout explores the intersection of accessibility and open source
item.itunes:subtitle: Nic Steenhout recounts how barriers to access led him to getting involved in the open source community, reflects on challenges that accessibility advocates face in the ecosystem, and gives some advice to projects on how to prove their commitment to accessibility.
item.itunes:summary: Nic Steenhout recounts how barriers to access led him to getting involved in the open source community, reflects on challenges that accessibility advocates face in the ecosystem, and gives some advice to projects on how to prove their commitment to accessibility.
item.description: Nic Steenhout recounts how barriers to access led him to getting involved in the open source community, reflects on challenges that accessibility advocates face in the ecosystem, and gives some advice to projects on how to prove their commitment to accessibility.

item.itunes:title: Elana Hashman on the evolution of open source
item.title: Elana Hashman on the evolution of open source
item.itunes:subtitle: Elana Hashman recounts her first contribution to open source, the ecosystem’s potential, how norms have changed over the years, and what keeps her involved and contributing.
item.itunes:summary: Elana Hashman recounts her first contribution to open source, the ecosystem’s potential, how norms have changed over the years, and what keeps her involved and contributing.
item.description: Elana Hashman recounts her first contribution to open source, the ecosystem’s potential, how norms have changed over the years, and what keeps her involved and contributing.

item.itunes:title: Joe Beda on open source as a positive sum game
item.title: Joe Beda on open source as a positive sum game
item.itunes:subtitle: Joe Beda shares with Julia and Amanda about his multigenerational family history with computers, his changing experience with open source since submitting the first commit to Kubernetes, and how the future of open source contains both 'danger and opportunity'.
item.itunes:summary: Joe Beda shares with Julia and Amanda about his multigenerational family history with computers, his changing experience with open source since submitting the first commit to Kubernetes, and how the future of open source contains both 'danger and opportunity'.
item.description: Joe Beda shares with Julia and Amanda about his multigenerational family history with computers, his changing experience with open source since submitting the first commit to Kubernetes, and how the future of open source contains both 'danger and opportunity'.

item.itunes:title: Samson Goddy on the power of centering open source on community needs
item.title: Samson Goddy on the power of centering open source on community needs
item.itunes:subtitle: Samson talks with Amanda about his lifelong journey in open source, why growing a culture of sharing is so important, and how his early experiences influenced where and how he has directed his energy into re-centering the nexus of open source.
item.itunes:summary: Samson talks with Amanda about his lifelong journey in open source, why growing a culture of sharing is so important, and how his early experiences influenced where and how he has directed his energy into re-centering the nexus of open source.

item.itunes:title: Josh Simmons and open source diplomacy
item.title: Josh Simmons and open source diplomacy
item.itunes:subtitle: Josh Simmons, Amanda Casari, and Julia Ferraioli talk about open source representation, transformative moments that led to increased participation, and hopes for the future.
item.itunes:summary: Josh Simmons, Amanda Casari, and Julia Ferraioli talk about open source representation, transformative moments that led to increased participation, and hopes for the future.
item.description: Josh Simmons, Amanda Casari, and Julia Ferraioli talk about open source representation, transformative moments that led to increased participation, and hopes for the future.

item.itunes:title: Aaron Patterson, Amanda Casari, and Julia Ferraioli
item.title: Aaron Patterson, Amanda Casari, and Julia Ferraioli
item.itunes:subtitle:
Aaron Patterson talks with Julia and Amanda about installing Linux for the first time, the story behind first patch, initial hesitancy around forking, and shares some advice for fellow programmers. Features plenty of bad puns from everyone.
Transcript: https://www.opensourcestories.org/stories/2021/aaron-patterson/
item.itunes:summary:
Aaron Patterson talks with Julia and Amanda about installing Linux for the first time, the story behind first patch, initial hesitancy around forking, and shares some advice for fellow programmers. Features plenty of bad puns from everyone.

item.itunes:title: Open Source Stories with Russell Keith-Magee
item.title: Open Source Stories with Russell Keith-Magee
item.itunes:subtitle: Russell talks with julia about his open source origin story, how he became involved in his first project, and what he sees as current issues with maintainership in open source.
item.itunes:summary: Russell talks with julia about his open source origin story, how he became involved in his first project, and what he sees as current issues with maintainership in open source.
